alert.note: Alert for Anderson (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 15 at 6:09AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Northern Anderson County in upstate South Carolina. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 603 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain linering over the region. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Please be wary of flooding of low-lying areas from the Saluda River westward to highway 76 where locally heavy runoff is lingering. This includes but is not limited to the headwaters of Three and Twenty, Six and Twenty and select creeks flowing into the Saluda River. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Easley, Welcome, Powdersville, Piedmont, Northlake, Pendleton, and Sandy Springs. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed.
